thread.title: Gareth Bale to make Real Madrid return against Espanyol this weekend for first time since ankle surgery in November
thread.title_full: Gareth Bale to make Real Madrid return against Espanyol this weekend for first time since ankle surgery in November

author: ashilton
title: Gareth Bale to make Real Madrid return against Espanyol this weekend for first time since ankle surgery in November
text:
EFL BALE'S BACK Gareth Bale to make Real Madrid return against Espanyol this weekend for first time since ankle surgery in November 
Welsh wizard returns after lengthy layoff to spearhead Real's charge for domestic and European glory BY JOE MAINLAND Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments TIMING is everything in football, and Gareth Bale’s return to the Real Madrid first-team couldn’t be better. 
The Welshman is back in Zinedine Zidane’s squad for the first time since injuring his ankle in November 2016. Getty Images Gareth Bale back in Real Madrid training after having surgery for a damaged tendon in his ankle 
Bale underwent surgery after suffering ankle tendon damage in Real’s champions league win over Sporting Lisbon. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Football gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Up until that point, Bale was on fire scoring 11 goals in 20 games for club and country. EPA Gareth Bale back to full fitness after an operation to fix ankle ligament damage Zidane and Modric discuss Gareth Bale's comeback and taking on Napoli 
Bale's return is a mjor boost as Zidane's side fight for the La Liga title and look for an historic 12th champions league. 
Real sit top of La Liga one point ahead of their great rivals Barcelona, but have what could prove to be two crucial games in hand. 
Los Blancos head to Espanyol, whilst Barca will look to get over their heavy European defeat to Paris Saint Germain at Leganes on Saturday. RELATED STORIES Rumour mill Fabinho to Man United, David de Gea to Real Madrid and Zaha to Tottenham: Ten transfers that could happen TOP CLUBS CHASE "MANNEQUIN" Transfer News: Manchester United, City, Arsenal and Real Madrid all tracking Inter Milan defender Jeison Murillo I'M IN THE MONEY Former Arsenal and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra is heading to the Chinese Super League need for speed Gareth Bale revealed as the fastest footballer on the planet... alongside Aaron Lennon 'secret phonecalls' Lionel Messi 'would love' Pep Guardiola back at Barca as Nou Camp chiefs step up boss search 
Although the Welsh star is back in the fold, it is unlikely he will start, but nevertheless Zidane is glad to have him back: "Bale is a very important player for us. The Frenchman going on to say, "He's very happy to return to the team, to be with us, and be able to play again."
